physical_appearance: The image depicts a box. The sides and the edges of the box have been worn out. Each exterior face of the box is predominantly red, surrounded by a yellow with dots painted on it as the motif. An image of a Hindu avatar of Vishnu, in a seated position, is depicted on each side of the box.
sgcool_label_text: Ganjifa is pan-Indian, played in its various forms in Indian regions including Maharashtra, Rajasthan, Bengal, Orissa, Karnataka, among others. The ganjifa game of cards originated in Persia but it really flourished in India where the game developed in various forms. Meanwhile, in Persia, the game largely died out. Initially in India, the game was played by the Mughals of northern India, but it soon spread to most parts of the country. The proposed set underscore a rare aspect of Indian heritage â€“ a craft tradition akin to miniature painting and a lesser known Indian game.
